Ask HN: Should people meet 1) their bf/gf 2) their elected reps for free?
text:
This is a general thought experiment about rent-seeking. [1]

I wonder about two relationships everyone cares about:

1. Everyone cares about their bf/gf (or spouse once they have one but a bf/gf is a prerequisite)

2. Most of the world is democratic, people care about their duly elected representatives.

My question is, should people be able to meet these people without third-party rent-seekers attempting to extract money out of the relationship?

Examples of third party rent seeking would be if you couldn't meet your own boyfriend or girlfriend without going on trips you don't want to take (you could imagine tinder partners with a travel agency and hides local matches but gives you distant matches and airline tickets) or if you couldn't meet your elected representative without paying some sort of tax such as if event invitations you sign up for on the politician's email list were sold to ad agencies who filled up all the seats with actors who aren't there to meet the representative but just redirect you at the door to some unrelated paid event or to pay to talk to someone else?

Basically my question is whether people should be able to meet their gf/bf or elected reps for free by simple invitation without paying third party rent-seekers?

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rent-seeking

Ask HN: What MDM/Endpoint security you use in a small startup?
text:
In the process of SOC2. All MDM tools feels outdated. We are small startup, we don't need to ship a device from Apple preconfigured, etc. Those features don't interest me. We are already 10 people and not growing that fast for device configuration to be a concern.

I just want the devices to stay secure and compliant, and also keep our SOC2 people happy. At previous work, I evaluated many anti-virus for Mac, installed CarbonBlack to 100+ people. All it found was a Windows virus on a Mac on a plugged hard drive over 2 years. Not dismissing, but our company got acquired, we deprecated it, we saw 2 more anti-virus which was only problems. I don't want to just check a checkbox.

So far, the closest I feel is Kolide of easier visibility & Slack based remediation (bugging people works), looked at Jamf Now and SimpleMDM. You can safely uninstall any MDM too, so I don't see what the point is unless the device is locked and encrypted. Don't want to be dismissive, just looking to hear ideas!
